intro: Chamaecrista aspera var. mohrii, commonly known as Mohri's sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the fruit is a slender, curved pod that contains several seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments due to its drought tolerance.
